text: While we can probably all agree that Samsung’s high-end flagships are the best devices that you can get right now, folks looking to save some cash (or stick to a certain budget) might be better off with Samsung’s more affordable options. For example, the Samsung Galaxy A16 comes with some reasonably decent specs, especially for buyers who just want the basics. In terms of specs, the Galaxy A16 comes with a 6.7-inch AMOLED screen, Exynos 1330 chipset, 4GB of RAM, and a triple-camera setup with a 50MP main sensor. With that said though, the phone’s biggest highlight is its length of software support – Samsung says that it’s offering up to six years of major Android upgrades for the Galaxy A16, which should be ideal for people who stick with their phones for the long run.
